numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Young women tend to contact their parents more often than young men.
2. Young women contact their parents through texts or calls or visits.
3. The most common form of communication is texting.
4. Phone calls and video calls are less common than texting.
5. In-person visits are less common than phone calls and video calls.
6. I wonder what group of people the sample was taken from.
7. I wonder whether the people in the sample are college students.
8. I wonder whether the people in the sample are recent college graduates.
9. I wonder what the age range of the people in the sample is.
10. Many college students live away from their parents.
12. I live away from my parents.
13. Many college students mainly communicate with their parents through texting and calling.
14. I mainly communicate with my parents through texting and calling.
15. It is not easy to find time to go back home.
16. If home is three hours away, then it is not easy to go back home.
17. If home is in a different state, then it is not easy to go back home.
18. The headline is: Dialing Home: When do young adults contact their parents?
